article.headline: George Washington 59, Richmond 53
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP) -- Rob Diggs had 18 of his 20 points in the first half and Damian Hollis ignited a second half run as George Washington upset Richmond 59-53 Saturday in an Atlantic 10 conference game. The Spiders led 40-33 with 12:37 left before Hollis scored eight points, all from the foul line, in a 16-0 run that gave the Colonials a 49-40 lead. Hollis had 16 points and made all 10 free throws for George Washington (8-14, 4-8), who have won six straight games against Richmond. The Colonials have won two straight games for the first time since starting the season 2-0. Kevin Anderson had 12 points and David Gonzalvez added 11 for the Spiders (14-11, 7-5), who began the day tied for second in the conference. Hollis fouled out with 1:18 left on a drive to the basket by Gonzalvez, whose two free throws pulled the Spiders to within 53-51. But Cheyenne Moore of GW hit five free throws in the closing 67 seconds as the Colonials won despite missing all 12 3-point attempts. George Washington trailed 32-25 at halftime but took its first lead of the game at 41-40 on two free throws by Hollis midway through the second half. The Colonials had won the previous five games against Richmond by an average of 16 points per game.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
